column4: is anyone free to help me with my issue? my windows xp pro sp2 is running fine on my very new computer and i want to install gutsy - but the live cd cant boot it unless i choose safe graphics mode. trying the normal way of starting, it just prints four lines and stops
hate to repeat it but... ><
what amount of RAM you have?
and whats display card?
its an onboard NVIDIA GeForce7100
then use safe gfx mode & install :)
just install ubuntu & then solve your gfx problems
ok. i have two disks: a 250 gb where windows is installed and an unused 320 gb that i cant get ubuntu or windows to see, only my bios detects it fine. how do you recommend i install?
how do you know that your 320gb hdd is not detected by ubuntu?
wait, i might have seen it wrongly, ill connect to this channel again once i start ubuntu via live cd, brb
im on gutsy right now
ok go on install it, the known problem during install are: https://wiki.ubuntu.com/CommonProblemsInstall
is there any data in that disk?
then go ahead , as this option erases all data on disk :)
not necessary , all most all drivers are installed by default, a few are they which are not open source so they are not installed by default
The boot loader would then read the operating system in from an outside storage
do i need it?
yes off course unless you don't plan to use your OS :p
lol, it depends how to setup the installer, now don't stop it, else surely you will lose data
yes
also there are many other ways to get help
i understand :)
depends upon hardware
ok
